snippet: The decision of Canadian aboriginal leaders to bring concerns over a pipeline project to Chinese leaders illustrates how China is steadily being drawn into internal disputes in other nations as its global commercial interests mushroom.
abstract: Canadian aboriginal leaders fire off open letter to China's Pres Hu Jintao over pipeline project that China has an investment in, ahead of Canadian Prime Min Stephen Harper's visit there; China is being drawn ever more steadily into other nations' internal disputes as its global commercial and diplomatic interests mushroom.

byline.original: By IAN JOHNSON and MICHAEL WINES

lead_paragraph: The decision of Canadian aboriginal leaders to bring concerns over a pipeline project to Chinese leaders illustrates how China is steadily being drawn into internal disputes in other nations as its global commercial interests mushroom.

headline.seo: Talks With Canadians Test China’s Policy of Noninterference
headline.main: As Canadians Talk Business, China’s Longtime Stance of Noninterference Is Tested
headline.print_headline: As Canadians Talk Business, China’s Longtime Stance of Noninterference Is Tested
